title: PRIVACY POLICY FOR PITBULLTAX.COM
content:
PRIVACY POLICY FOR PITBULLTAX.COM


  1. Access, Purchase and Registration
    Welcome to the website (the “Website”) of Negotiation Technologies, LLC, (hereinafter referred to as “NTL” or “we”). When you (“User”) access the Website, or purchase or license products and services for this Website, NTL may collect information such as name, address, tax ID numbers, and the like. Some of our applications at the Website require you to register. During the registration process we ask for your name, address, and e-mail address, and we may ask for additional identifying information. We may also ask you to answer some optional questions about yourself. We may obtain additional information about you, such as address change information, from commercially available sources, in order to keep our records current.
  2. Access and Delivery
    You may be asked to supply a username and password and to answer security questions which you have the opportunity to select. We use this method to allow you to access your services in accordance with the Terms of the Website.
  3. Social Media, Community and Feedback
    1. We may provide discussion forums, blogs and other community-oriented features that enable you to post comments and comment on posts by others. To participate in a NTL forum, we may require you to register with a valid e-mail address. We may use your e-mail address to contact you regarding your postings or to inquire about your community experience. We also have many places where users can provide feedback and suggestions. Answering is optional.
    2. We may also offer you the opportunity to share your experience with a review or other comment or provide you a service via various third-party social media such as Google, Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube in a number of text, video, and image formats. Registration with those services may be separately required. Participation in social media is voluntary and you choose what you post. We recommend that you exercise discretion in posting information. Information that you post may be obtained and used by others. Do not reveal information that you do not want to make public, such as by posting your contact information or email address. Remember, material and images uploaded to Internet sites may be copied, without consent, by people who access them.

  4. Information Sharing
    NTL does not sell, rent, trade or otherwise share your personal information with anyone other than third party service providers, agents or contractors (Service Providers) acting on our behalf for limited purposes in performance of our services and in accordance with NTL’s Security Policy (“Special Purposes”).
  5. How We Use Information
    1. We do not sell or rent your personal information or your client’s tax resolution information to anyone.
    2. We do not share your personal information with anyone, other than our affiliate program members, for their promotional or marketing use, or Third-Party Service Providers for the performance of the Special Purposes. “Affiliates” means an individual or business generating their own traffic which may be rewarded for legitimate sales, leads, clicks, or other measurable action.
    3. NTL may use your personal or your clients’ information to manage your account, to contact you and to operate, improve, and deliver our products and services, including the Website. We may use your personal information to provide you with information and services you request, if appropriate, to tell you about NTL products and services, and to give you a customized, interactive experience as you use our products. We may use your personal information to charge you for the products and services you purchase. We use the contact information you provide to communicate with you. We may use your clients’ tax resolution information to aid in the preparation of documents for the IRS and provide related assistance and services.
    4. We may retain information provided to us in accordance with IRS and state regulations. This information may also be used to perform analysis relating to your claims under our guarantees, or to provide you with a copy of the information for your convenience.
  6. Information Security
    1. While no website can guarantee security, NTL has implemented appropriate administrative, technical, and physical security procedures to help protect the personal information you provide to us. We protect the confidentiality and security of your personal information by using safeguards such as firewalls. Your Website-based services are password protected, and we recommend that you do not share your password with anyone. We recommend that you sign out of your Website-based product and services and close your browser window when you have finished your work. This prevents others from accessing your account if you share a computer or use a computer in a public place, such as a library, Internet café or publicly available WiFi-enabled area.
    2. You must be aware of identity theft, fraud and scams and take responsibility for protecting yourself. We recommend that you do not reply or click on any links in the e-mail or provide any personal information without verifying that the e-mail is legitimate.
    3. The Website resides behind a firewall and uses SSL (Secure Sockets Layer protocol) to transmit personal information. Data is encrypted during transmission to help ensure that personal and payment information is secure. Data encryption techniques are used to protect personal information on NTL computers. SSL-capable browsers typically have a symbol on the browser window to indicate when they are in a secure mode. In addition, the URL may begin with "https:" to indicate that SSL protocol is in place.
  7. Non-personal Information
    Non-personal information may be collected by NTL and used to compile general website usage statistics or facilitate access to restricted website services. Such information includes:
    1. IP address of computer - IP address is used to verify visitors to our website to assist in order fulfillment and for our own marketing purposes. It also aids in the general administration of the website to see how we can better serve our customers.
    2. Browser related information.
    3. Locations visited on the website.
  8. Chatbot Data Privacy Disclosure
    Under California Invasion of Privacy Act (CIPA), data collected via chatbot requires notice or direct consent by the site visitors engaging with the chat due to the chat transcript being recorded and run in the United States. NTL does not monitor or view the contents of Customer chats with its site visitors (unless and only to the extent expressly directed by the Customer to do so during customer success calls). Further, NTL does not use any such chats or the contents thereof for its own purposes, nor does it sell such to third parties.
  9. Cookies and related technology
    NTL may use cookies, Locally Shared Objects, Web beacons, or similar technology to keep track of user session identity on the Website, such as tracking items in a shopping cart. Cookies may also be used to track the effectiveness of various services provided on the NTL website. Browsers generally allow you to disable cookies or delete cookies after a web session. Services on the NTL website that require a login to a NTL account may require that cookies are enabled.
  10. Collection and Use of Children's Personal Information
    1. If you are under 18 years old, please read this message with your parents before you visit our Website.
    2. NTL’s products are intended to be used by adults. Should a child whom we know to be under 13 send personal information to us, we will use that information only to respond directly to that child to inform him or her that we must have parental consent before receiving his or her personal information.
    3. Please ask questions about things you do not understand. If you are under age 13, you should get a parent's permission before submitting any information about yourself on this Website.
    4. NTL does not contact children under age 13 about special offers or for marketing purposes without a parent's permission.
  11. Data Collection, Retention, Use and Deletion of Google Data

    NTL stores your personal information for a period that is consistent with its business purposes. NTL retains your personal information for the length of time necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law.

    When the data retention period for a given type of data expires, NTL will take appropriate steps to delete or destroy it in a secure manner.

    NTL integrates with Google Drive to enhance your experience, enabling functionalities such as file management and synchronization. This integration allows NTL to:

    1. Access and manage your files on Google Drive, including the ability to download or delete files in sync with our applications.
    2. Monitor and detect modifications in existing files to ensure seamless syncing with our applications.
    3. Manage Google documents, acknowledging their unique storage format on Google Drive, by downloading or deleting as necessary.

    Users have control over the data shared with NTL through Google services and can manage their Google account settings to control the information shared with NTL. NTL is committed to transparently disclosing how it accesses, uses, stores, and shares Google user data in accordance with this Privacy Policy and Google’s Limited Use requirements. Our use of Google user data is strictly limited to the functionalities described above and any other practices explicitly disclosed in our product-specific privacy notices.

    You may request for your personal data to be deleted at any time by contacting us at info@pitbulltax.com. Please note that in some cases, NTL may be required to retain certain information for legal or regulatory purposes, or to complete ongoing transactions.

  12. Privacy Policy for Artificial Intelligence Companion
    This section explains the integration of AI companion into NTL's services and explains the scope of usage in the privacy policy.
    1. Data Collection
      The AI companion may collect data during interactions to provide accurate and relevant responses. This data includes user queries, preferences, and interaction history.
    2. Data Usage
      The collected data will be used to enhance the functionality of the AI companion, improve user experience, and provide personalized services.
    3. Data Security
      NTL employs stringent security measures to protect data collected by the AI companion, including encryption and access controls.
    4. Data Protection
      Specific client identifying data will never be shared or used in AI-generated content.
    5. User Rights
      Users have the right to access, correct, or delete data generated by the AI companion.
    6. AI Model Information
      NTL uses OpenAI ChatGPT-4o as the large language model for the AI Companion.
  13. Changes to this Privacy Policy
    NTL reserves the right to update or modify this Privacy Policy at any time without prior notice. Your use of the Website following any such change constitutes your agreement to follow and be bound by the Privacy Policy as modified. For this reason, we encourage you to review the Privacy Policy each time you use this Website.

    If you believe that our website has collected incorrect information or if you would like to dispute any information, please contact us using the following address: Negotiation Technologies, LLC, 6250 Coral Ridge Drive Suite 100, Coral Springs, FL 33076.
